required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: VIVO in a Practical Clinical Experience

brief_summary.textblock: A multi-center, observational registry conducted in Europe and the UK to prospectively review VIVO in a clinical setting in 125 patients.

primary_outcome.description: The primary effectiveness objective is to assess the types of procedures where VIVO is used to plan and/or guide the ablation procedure or to determine a diagnosis of arrhythmia. Primary Effectiveness endpoint: Summarize the types of procedures where VIVO was utilized in the procedure.
Primary safety objective is to assess any adverse events related to the device and procedure. Primary Safety endpoint: Summarize the number of adverse events related to VIVO or procedure.

secondary_outcome.description: Secondary effectiveness objective is to evaluate the success of the ablation procedure (if performed) at follow- up visits (3, 6 and 12 months). Secondary effectiveness endpoint: Summarize the success of the ablation procedure at each follow up visit.

arm_group.description: Patients in which VIVO is used.

intervention.description: VIVO is a per-procedural planning tool designed to non-invasively identify the origin of a ventricular arrhythmia.

study_pop.textblock: Patients experiencing ventricular tachycardia (VT) or premature ventricular contractions (PVC) and being considered for or have a scheduled a ventricular ablation procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must at least 18 years of age Patients who have signed an IRB/EC approved patient informed consent and applicable patient privacy protection authorization per local law
- Patients who have previously had contrast cardiac imaging or will have cardiac imaging ordered per standard of care
- Patients will be selected without regard to gender.
Exclusion Criteria:
â€¢ Patients that are unable to receive contrast cardiac imaging (MR or CT)

patient_data.ipd_description: NO IPD is to be shared with other researchers.
